gurmukhi: eyk eyk suvrn ko idj eyk dIjY Bwr ]
transliteration: Ek Ek Suvaran Ko Dij Ek Deejai Bhaar||
translation: The orders were given for giving one load of gold to each Brahmin.

gurmukhi: eyk sau gj eyk sau riQ duie shMsR quKwr ]
transliteration: Ek Sau Gad Ek Sau Rath(i) Due Sahansra Toukhaar||
translation: One hundred elephants, one hundred chariots and two thousand horses;

gurmukhi: shMs cqr suvrn isMgI mihK dwn Apwr ]
transliteration: Sahans Chatar Suvaran Singimahikh Daan Apaar||
translation: And also four thousand cow with gilded horns and innumerable buffalos in charity;

gurmukhi: eyk eykih dIjIAY sun rwj rwj Aauqwr ]2]143]
transliteration: Ek Ekah(i) Deejeeai Soun Raaj Raaj Aoutaar||2||143||
translation: Listen O Chief of the Kings, give these gifts to each Brahmin.2.143.

gurmukhi: suvrn dwn su rukm dwn su qwNbR dwn AnMq ]
transliteration: Suvaran Daan Su Roukam Daan Su Taanbra Daan Anant||
translation: Innumerable articles like gold, silver and copper were given in charity.

gurmukhi: AMn dwn AnMq dIjq dyK dIn durMq ]
transliteration: Ann Daan Anant Deejat Dekh Deen Durant||
translation: Innumerable alms of grain were given to many gathered poor people.

gurmukhi: bsqR dwn ptMbR dwn su ssqR dwn idjMq ]
transliteration: Bastra Daan Patanbra Daan Su Sastra Daan Dijant||
translation: Other items given in charity were the common clothes, silken clothes and weapons.

gurmukhi: BUp iB`Ck huie gey sB dys dys durMq ]3]144]
transliteration: Bhoop Bhichchhak Hue Gad Sabh Des Des Durant||3||144||
translation: The beggars from many countries became well-off.3.144.

gurmukhi: cqR kos bnwie kuMfk shMsR lwie prnwr ]
transliteration: Chatra Kos Banaae Koundak Sahansra Lae Parnaar||
translation: The fire-altar extended upto four kos and had one thousand drains.

gurmukhi: shMsR hom krY lgY idj byd ibAws Aauqwr ]
transliteration: Sahansra Hom Darai Lagad Dij Bed Biaas Aoutaar||
translation: One thousand Brahmins, considered incarnations of Ved Vyas, began the performance of sacrifice.

gurmukhi: hsq suMf pRmwn GiRq kI prq Dwr Apwr ]
transliteration: Hasat Sound Pramaan Ghrit Kiparat Dhaar Apaar||
translation: The continuous current of clarified butter of the size of elephantâ€™s trunk fell in the pit.

gurmukhi: hoq Bsm Anyk ibMjn lpt Jpt krwl ]4]145]
transliteration: Hot Bhasam Anek Binjan Lapat Jhapat Karaal||4||145||
translation: Many materials were reduced to ashes by the dreadful flame.4.145.

gurmukhi: miRqkw sB qIrQ kI sB qIrQ ko lY bwr ]
transliteration: Mritakaa Sabh Teerath Kisabh Teerath Ko Lai Baar||
translation: The earth and water of all the pilgrim-stations was broutht.

gurmukhi: kwstkw sB dys kI sB dys kI ijau nwr ]
transliteration: Kaastakaa Sabh Des Kisabh Des Kijio Naar||
translation: Also the fuel-wood and food-materials from all countries;
